caption.title: Epidemic growth depends on circadian rhythms.
caption.p: For each city, the time until 10% of locations are infected (Γ 10%), averaged over epidemics for each of the different introduction timings and sites. We compare simulations in settings with the time-dependent transmission rate at three different strengths of the circadian effects (high C = 1, medium C = 0.5 and no C = 0 circadian effect). Epidemic growth varies in different cities and levels of circadian rhythms. Larger Γ 10% is observed with the time dependent transmission rate than without, decreasingly with higher C.
